projects.title: GlucoseMR
projects.subtitle: Secure Mixed Reality Health Tool

content.problem: Diabetes management requires frequent data checking, but current solutions lack privacy-focused spatial interfaces that integrate naturally into daily life.
content.solution: Built a mixed-reality diabetes management tool using real-time computer vision and voice interaction, with robust hand tracking and privacy-first architecture.
technical: Unity/XR architecture with SecureMR integration
Custom speech input parser for voice commands
Hand tracking and interaction system design
Privacy-focused architectural decisions validated with ByteDance engineers

awards: Stanford Immerse the Bay XR Hackathon - SecureMR Track Winner

projects.title: Order's Up
projects.subtitle: Co-located Multiplayer MR Game

content.problem: Co-located mixed reality experiences require complex networking with object authority, state synchronization, and late-join handlingâ€”areas with limited existing solutions.
content.solution: Developed real-time multiplayer infrastructure using Photon Fusion, including networked hand-tracking synchronization now being prepared as a reusable package.
technical: Photon Fusion real-time networking
Object authority and state reconciliation
Late-join handling for shared MR environments
Networked hand-tracking sync (Unity Asset Store package in progress)

awards: Meta-sponsored XR & AI Hackathon - Dual Track Winner

content.problem: XR training systems lack real-time adaptation to user cognitive and physiological state, limiting their effectiveness for skill acquisition.
content.solution: Designed a neuroadaptive system integrating OpenBCI Galea biosignals (EEG, EMG, eye-tracking, physiological) to drive adaptive VR training feedback.
technical: Real-time biosignal ingestion pipeline
EEG, EMG, eye-tracking, and physiological signal mapping
Modular signal-processing architecture
Balanced ML-driven behavior with deterministic real-time constraints

content.problem: Location-based AR experiences require robust image anchoring and spatial mapping while maintaining performance on mobile hardware.
content.solution: Architected a modular AR platform in Unity using ARCore, with optimized rendering and memory usage for consistent low-latency mobile performance.
technical: ARCore integration for real-time image anchoring
Spatial scene mapping system
Modular Unity architecture for multi-developer scalability
Platform-specific builds via preprocessor directives
Memory and rendering optimization for mobile

content.problem: Enterprise XR training requires complex simulation environments with consistent frame stability across varied hardware.
content.solution: Developed enterprise XR applications using Unity, OpenXR, and MRTK3, including LiDAR-scanned industrial environments and AI-driven interaction flows.
technical: Unity + OpenXR + MRTK3 architecture
LiDAR scan reconstruction to explorable 3D
AI-driven and voice-based interaction systems
CPU, GPU, and input pipeline profiling and optimization

career.title: Lead XR Software Engineer
highlights: Architected location-based AR platform in Unity using ARCore
Designed modular, scalable systems for multi-developer iteration
Optimized rendering and memory for mobile hardware

career.title: XR Software Developer
highlights: Developed enterprise XR applications with Unity, OpenXR, MRTK3
Integrated AI-driven interaction flows including voice systems
Profiled and optimized performance across platforms

career.title: AR Software Intern
highlights: Built emotion-responsive AR features using facial and affective signals
Reduced latency via Unity profiling on constrained devices
